msubsection.title: svnFileset
msubsection.p: FileSet replacement that operates on list of files obtained from Subversion.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.doc: Specifies the root directory used by the file set. It should specify a directory managed by Subversion.

attribute.name: file
attribute.doc: If used, specifies a fileset that contains a single file.

attribute.name: username
attribute.doc: username that will be used for all nested svn commands.

doc.b: Deprecated. This attribute won't work with SVNANT 1.3.2+ . Use refid for svnSetting instead.

attribute.name: password
attribute.doc: password that will be used for all nested svn commands.

doc.b: Deprecated. This attribute won't work with SVNANT 1.3.2+ . Use refid for svnSetting instead.

attribute.name: javahl
attribute.doc: Set to "false" to use command line client interface instead of JNI JavaHL binding.

doc.b: Deprecated. This attribute won't work with SVNANT 1.3.2+ . Use refid for svnSetting instead.

attribute.name: svnkit
attribute.doc: Set to "false" to use command line client interface instead of SVNKit binding.

doc.b: Deprecated. This attribute won't work with SVNANT 1.3.2+ . Use refid for svnSetting instead.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.doc: Controls whether an error stops the build or is merely reported to the screen.

doc.b: Deprecated. This attribute won't work with SVNANT 1.3.2+ . Use refid for svnSetting instead.

attribute.name: refid
attribute.doc: If set the configuration for this task is taken from a svnSetting object. Such a settings instance simply provides default values, so they will be overridden in case the corresponding attribute on this task has been set.

attribute.name: includes
attribute.doc: Comma-seperated or space-separated list of patterns, which describe files that are included. If this attribute if not specified, then all files are included.

attribute.name: excludes
attribute.doc: Comma-seperated or space-separated list of patterns, which describe files that are excluded. If this attribute if not specified, then no files are excluded.

nestedelement.name: exclude
nestedelement.doc: The type svnFileSet can include the nested type 'exclude', similar to a classic FileSet.

nestedelement.name: include
nestedelement.doc: The type svnFileSet can include the nested type 'include', similar to a classic FileSet.

nestedelement.name: patternSet
nestedelement.doc: The type svnFileSet can include the nested type 'patternSet', similar to a classic FileSet.

nestedelement.name: selector
nestedelement.doc: The type svnFileSet can include the any file selector, such as contains, date size, or any file selector defined by svn-ant

msubsection.p: This type implements a FileSet. Instances of FileSet are used in tasks that operates on a number of files. The files selected by a FileSet can be tailored by a number of patterns and selectors. More information about file sets is available with the Ant documentation.

The motivation with creating a replacement FileSet that is based on Subversion was to have the ability of creating sets of files that include deleted and missing files. In fact, the classic fileset operates only on files that are reported by the file system and can not predict deleted and missing files. Furthermore, there are useful commands that can be performed on deleted and missing files, such as 'revert', 'delete', 'update' and others.
At the present time, svnFileSet is experimental. It supports selectors but it does not yet accept any patterns (include, exclude). Those enhancements are to come later.

svnFileSet can be used within any svn-ant task that supports a nested file sets. It can also be used in any task that is based on a file set. If you have a problem using svnFileSet within a task that works well with the classic fileset, then report the problem to the author of the task. However, for the time being, there is a work around your problem. Instead of using a svnFileSet directly in the targeted task, use it indirectly via a classic fileset and a reference. For example, if ANT complains about a task similar to the following:

The following ant script can be used to remove all missing files from the associated repository:
msubsection.snippet: <svn> <delete> <svnFileSet dir="workingcopy"> <svnMissing/> </svnFileSet> </delete> <commit dir="workingcopy" message="automatically removing missing files" /> </svn>
